qas.question: What was Czech civilization called back in the day?
What Holy Roman Emperor expedited the growth of Bohemia in the 14th century?
When was Charles University founded in Prague?
Who contributed heavily to the effort to standardize Czech orthography?
What did Jan Hus advocate for among the Czech commoners?
What university was founded by Jan Hus?
In what city did Jan Hus found Charles University?
In what year did Jan Hus found Charles University?

plausible_answers.text: a biblical translation, hymns and hagiography

qas.question: What works were written by Jan Hus?
What type of literature was written by Czech commoners in 1348?

context: <a0_0>Bohemia<a0_0/> (as Czech civilization was known by then) increased in power over the centuries, as its language did in regional importance. This growth was expedited during the fourteenth century by Holy Roman Emperor <a1_0>Charles IV<a1_0/>, who founded <b5_0>Charles University<b5_0/> in <b6_0>Prague<b6_0/> in <a2_0><b7_0>1348<b7_0/><a2_0/>. Here, early Czech literature (<b8_0>a biblical translation, hymns and hagiography<b8_0/>) flourished. Old Czech texts, including <b9_0>poetry and cookbooks<b9_0/>, were produced outside the university as well. Later in the century <a3_0>Jan Hus<a3_0/> contributed significantly to the standardization of Czech orthography, advocated for <a4_0>widespread literacy<a4_0/> among Czech commoners (particularly in religion) and made early efforts to model written Czech after the spoken language.
